bibl.title: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to Joseph H. White, June 22, 1922

div1.p: Noguchi writes to White regarding the appearance of human experimentation in the 1921 Rockefeller Foundation report. Noguchi had attributed the experiment to White.

div1.head: Letter from Hideyo Noguchi to Joseph H. White, June 22, 1922
div1.p:
I have received from Dr. Vincent the
correspondence of which I am enclosing copies.

If I am not mistaken, you told me when
you were in New York last fall, soon after your return
from Peru, that a group of 50 non-immune Peruvian soldiers,
25 of whom were vaccinated and 25 left unvaccinated, were sent
into an infected district, and that 20 of the 25 unvaccinated
came down with yellow fever, while no cases occurred among
the 25 who were vaccinated. As you will gather from the
enclosed correspondence, I am very anxious to know who
conducted these vaccinations, where they were done, and from
whom you learned of them. I shall be greatly indebted to
you if you will enlighten me on these points. I took if for
granted that the statement coming from you was authentic and
have quoted it in my report to the Board of Scientific
Directors of the Institute and to the International Health
Board. I have also mentioned it, stating that I received
the information from you, in an article which I wrote for
publication in England. If the statement cannot be verified
I shall have to retract it. I hope there has been no mis-
understanding in the matter.

I hope that you are in good health and
that everything is going well with the work in Mexico. We
are shipping the vaccine for the Mexican troops at the rate
of about 2,000 doses a month since our initial shipment of
4,000 doses. I hope that the vaccinations will be continued,
notwithstanding we could not send the entire amount at once.
I believe there may be an advantage in sending a fresh supply
frequently, as we are now doing.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, (Signed) Hideyo Noguchi Dr. Joseph H. White
Departamento de Salubriada Publica
Mexico City, Mexico
